title: AB de Royse777
author: AB de Royse777
content: Forum PM (Outbox)Now someone suggest me how would I going to find a PM (Outbox) that I sent to a specific user (or may be I have not sent yet)? I don't know the subject too.I went through 13 pages back manually and checked one after another, now I lost interest to find more pages LOL.Have fun, Cheers!

comments.author: Harkorede
comments.body: You can easily use the search messages option on the left side oy your screen under "Preference", all you just need to do is include the probable word you are quite sure you might have used in the content of this said message, when it brings out the results in the "Author" column, it's going to show your username instead of the recipient(s) and/or probably both, your username being the Author indicates that it is an outbox message.

comments.author: AB de Royse777
comments.body: Quote from: Harkorede on November 20, 2023, 02:44:19 PMYou can easily use the search messages option on the left side oy your screen under "Preference", all you just need to do is include the probable word you are quite sure you might have used in the content of this said message, when it brings out the results in the "Author" column, it's going to show your username instead of the recipient(s) and/or probably both, your username being the Author indicates that it is an outbox message.I already did before creating this topic. Doesn't work for outbox :-(

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Alternatively, you could just click on that "To" button. It will arrange usernames of members you have sent messages to in the past alphabetically in a descending or ascending order. Now all you have to do is scroll through the specific username you have in mind after zeroing down on the page.

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.created_time: November 20, 2023, 02:50:49 PMLast edit: November 22, 2023, 05:19:01 PM by DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: Harkorede on November 20, 2023, 02:44:19 PM<…>The search function you mention only works on the inbox though, not on the outbox. As far as I’m aware, there is no way to search the outbox. The best one can do is sort by "to" by clicking the header, and then find the pages related to the user being sought, scrolling through the posts which are then ordered by date (ascending).Note: quick snaps

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Unfortunately, the Search Personal Messages function only works with received messages in your "Inbox", not with "Outbox". So, I don't think there is an easy way right now, except to manually go through all the pages in your outbox and use the search function in the browser (F3) for a quick keyword search.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: Quote from: Harkorede on November 20, 2023, 02:44:19 PMYou can easily use the search messages option on the left side oy your screen under "Preference", all you just need to do is include the probable word you are quite sure you might have used in the content of this said message, when it brings out the results in the "Author" column, it's going to show your username instead of the recipient(s) and/or probably both, your username being the Author indicates that it is an outbox message.This doesn't work, when you search a someone messages with his username it will filter all his or her post to you whereby it won't give the real results. I just searched of someone messages on inbox/outbox but i didn't get the right message rather than a total filter of their post where his names are being post on the forum.

comments.author: AB de Royse777
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on November 20, 2023, 02:50:21 PMAlternatively, you could just click on that "To" button. It will arrange usernames of members you have sent messages to in the past alphabetically in a descending or ascending order. Now all you have to do is scroll through the specific username you have in mind after zeroing down on the page.This was very useful and I found the desired outbox message I was looking for. Cheers bud.

comments.author: Harkorede
comments.body: Quote from: Royse777 on November 20, 2023, 02:47:55 PMQuote from: Harkorede on November 20, 2023, 02:44:19 PMYou can easily use the search messages option on the left side oy your screen under "Preference", all you just need to do is include the probable word you are quite sure you might have used in the content of this said message, when it brings out the results in the "Author" column, it's going to show your username instead of the recipient(s) and/or probably both, your username being the Author indicates that it is an outbox message.I already did before creating this topic. Doesn't work for outbox :-(I double checked, I believe I was only able to get result with my username in the Author's column because I responded to the PM with the "reply all" option which also included me as both the sender and one of the recipients, hence, the misinterpretation from me, after I opened the message I indeed discovered it was as an inbox, but with my username as the Author as well.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: Royse777 on November 20, 2023, 02:32:47 PMNow someone suggest me how would I going to find a PM (Outbox) that I sent to a specific user (or may be I have not sent yet)? I don't know the subject too.First you seriously need to start deleting bunch of your old redundant messages What I usually use is combination of search insider browser with CRTL+F function, and I rearrange messages by receiver or by date. PSIt would be very useful if Theymos or someone else could add option of manually exporting all our messages.Maybe material for new SMF patch by PowerGlove?

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on November 20, 2023, 04:52:33 PMPSIt would be very useful if Theymos or someone else could add option of manually exporting all our messages.Maybe material for new SMF patch by PowerGlove?  I could swear that I read somewhere many years ago that a full PM export is possible but only if theymos approves it. He also has to be the one to do it. It took me some time to find the post, but here is the proof that I haven't gone mad:Quote from: theymos on May 05, 2016, 03:39:35 AMI actually have code written for exporting PMs into an mbox file compatible with Thunderbird, but I haven't gotten around yet to figuring out how best to present this functionality to users. (It's unusual because it takes a bit of time to generate and the resulting file should maybe be encrypted.)If any established members have a strong need for it, I can manually create an export for you. For example, if you have so many PMs that the PM page is slow to load for you, you can get a PM export from me and then use the "purge PMs" feature. I'll probably only do this one time per person...Whether or not this offer is still available is another question.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Maybe you have made this kind of encounter because you probably receive alot of inbox and also sends messages often for you to have reach upto this far in numbers of pages for your PMs, someone like me will only receive messages occasionally, I've spent moe than a month without having PM, so i may not really see a need to engage searching through the exact message sent or received when the ones i have were few already to easily glance through, some don't even like keeping messages like that, but it's actually good for a reference sake in case of the future.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Quote from: Royse777 on November 20, 2023, 02:32:47 PMForum PM (Outbox)I am surprised that your outbox spanned upto 125 pages. This is really much, it seems you are busy in the pm as much as you are busy in the general forum. No wonder you always indicate that users shouldn't contact you through pm.Quote from: Royse777 on November 20, 2023, 02:57:36 PMQuote from: Bitcoin_Arena on November 20, 2023, 02:50:21 PMThis was very useful and I found the desired outbox message I was looking for. Cheers bud.Glad to know you got help. Maybe you may consider to lock the thread or it would be hijacked by sp...mers

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: I still haven't really been able to get a specific idea of how to manage sent messages.The search system only works for inbox, it does not work for outbox.Unfortunately, you can't use labels, so everything gets mixed up and there's no way to change it. At least I haven't found it yet.

comments.author: PytagoraZ
comments.body: Quote from: KingsDen on November 20, 2023, 07:30:14 PMQuote from: Royse777 on November 20, 2023, 02:32:47 PMForum PM (Outbox)I am surprised that your outbox spanned upto 125 pages. This is really much, it seems you are busy in the pm as much as you are busy in the general forum. No wonder you always indicate that users shouldn't contact you through pm.Let's do the math, and the number of messages Royse might receive in his outbox is 2,500, which is 30% of his regular posts. If we add an inbox then there is a 60% chance that Royse will be busier in PM than in regular posts.  Do you want to see my inbox? It looks cool and you will definitely be surprised when you see it

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: PytagoraZ on November 20, 2023, 11:06:34 PMQuote from: KingsDen on November 20, 2023, 07:30:14 PMQuote from: Royse777 on November 20, 2023, 02:32:47 PMForum PM (Outbox)I am surprised that your outbox spanned upto 125 pages. This is really much, it seems you are busy in the pm as much as you are busy in the general forum. No wonder you always indicate that users shouldn't contact you through pm.Let's do the math, and the number of messages Royse might receive in his outbox is 2,500, which is 30% of his regular posts. If we add an inbox then there is a 60% chance that Royse will be busier in PM than in regular posts.  Do you want to see my inbox? It looks cool and you will definitely be surprised when you see itMy inbox is huge    802My outbox is huge  601. so 1403 x 20 = 28000+and I deleted 2000-3000 ins and outs.so I find it interesting that I am 28000/43000 = 65% of my posts. Damn it is a lot

comments.author: johnsaributua
comments.body: The messages is a witness to the journey on the bitcointalk forum, and for me the private message feature is very important because when there is something to talk about personally with several people do not have to access private email and still take anonymity, focus on what is discussed in a small way and cannot be made replay or thread, the factor affects the quality of a topic if you want to discuss one or two sentences, indeed can only sort alphabetically from outbox recipients, I always delete periodically or the contents of useful messages I copy to notes for me to read later, no more than 3 pages of my inbox history, by sorting according to the alphabet and utilizing the page search feature (ctrl + f) on the browser, for me it is sufficient and effective, in the simplest and easiest way I can.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: Pmalek on November 20, 2023, 05:11:37 PMI could swear that I read somewhere many years ago that a full PM export is possible but only if theymos approves it. He also has to be the one to do it. It took me some time to find the post, but here is the proof that I haven't gone madOther than Theymos speaking about this back in 2016, I think that other members mentioned this idea several times in last few years.I don't think this is such a hard thing to add, since I only want to download messages that are available in my inbox and that are not deleted by me.Either that or we get a new forum software, because right now bitcointalk PM communication system is big pain in the ass

comments.author: Subbir
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on November 22, 2023, 02:30:23 AMMy inbox is huge    802My outbox is huge  601. so 1403 x 20 = 28000+and I deleted 2000-3000 ins and outs.so I find it interesting that I am 28000/43000 = 65% of my posts. Damn it is a lot You are the lucky man and a brilliant person for the recorded. achieved another record soon for a forum member.  Quote from: Royse777 on November 20, 2023, 02:57:36 PMThis was very useful and I found the desired outbox message I was looking for. Cheers bud.Right now this is the solved, my opinion is when the next time communicate in bitcointalk so use 'Subject' then easy for find out. thanks, @Bitcoin_Arena for solving this.

comments.author: PytagoraZ
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on November 22, 2023, 02:30:23 AMso I find it interesting that I am 28000/43000 = 65% of my posts. Damn it is a lot Let's do the math. Your regular posts are 43,700 and your inbox is 28,000 = 71,700 postsYou have been active for about 11 years71,700 : 11 years = 6,518 post per year6,518 : 365 days = 17.8 posts per day, That's crazy, you are really a high quality spamer, LOL   In fact, your posts are more than Robot ChartBuddyDo you still have 10 fingers after writing that much?
